---
title: "invalid_readonly.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file represents an invalid configuration for a storage system. It is specifically designed to test the behavior of a configuration parser when encountering an invalid read-only setting for an object storage type.

## Code Structure
This YAML file defines a single top-level key `storage` with nested configuration options for an object storage system.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The root configuration block for the storage system.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the storage type as "object"
- Sets the `read_only` flag to `false`, which is likely the source of invalidity for this test case
- Defines further configuration for the object storage

### `storage.object`
#### Description
Configures the specific object storage system.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies the object storage type as "s3"
- Provides configuration details for the S3 storage

### `storage.object.s3`
#### Description
Configures the S3-specific settings for the object storage.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the S3 bucket name to "testbucket"
- Defines a prefix for objects as "prefix"
- Specifies the AWS region as "region"
- Sets a poll interval of 5 minutes

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Value | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------|:------------|
| storage.type | string | "object" | Specifies the storage type as object storage |
| storage.read_only | boolean | false | Sets the read-only flag for the storage (likely invalid) |
| storage.object.type | string | "s3" | Specifies the object storage type as S3 |
| storage.object.s3.bucket | string | "testbucket" | The name of the S3 bucket |
| storage.object.s3.prefix | string | "prefix" | The prefix for objects in the S3 bucket |
| storage.object.s3.region | string | "region" | The AWS region for the S3 bucket |
| storage.object.s3.poll_interval | string | "5m" | The interval for polling the S3 bucket (5 minutes) |

## Error Handling
This file is intentionally configured with an invalid setting (`read_only: false`) to test error handling in the configuration parser. The parser should detect this invalid configuration and respond appropriately.
